verses.verse: And the Pharisees <S%G5330><s%> and some <S%G5100><s%> of the scribes <S%G1122><s%> gathered <S%G4863><s%> together <S%G4863><s%> around <S%G4314><s%> Him when they had come <S%G2064><s%> from Jerusalem, <S%G2414><s%>

and had seen <S%G3708><s%> that some <S%G5100><s%> of His disciples <S%G3101><s%> were eating <S%G2068><s%> their bread <S%G740><s%> with impure <S%G2839><s%> hands, <S%G5495><s%> that is, unwashed. <S%G449><s%>

(For the Pharisees <S%G5330><s%> and all <S%G3956><s%> the Jews <S%G2453><s%> do not eat <S%G2068><s%> unless <S%G1437><s%> <S%G3361><s%> they carefully <S%G4435><s%> wash <S%G3538><s%> their hands, <S%G5495><s%> [thus] observing <S%G2902><s%> the traditions <S%G3862><s%> of the elders; <S%G4245><s%>

and [when they come] from the market <S%G58><s%> place, <S%G58><s%> they do not eat <S%G2068><s%> unless <S%G1437><s%> <S%G3361><s%> they cleanse <S%G4472><s%> themselves; and there are many <S%G4183><s%> other <S%G243><s%> things <S%G4183><s%> which <S%G3739><s%> they have received <S%G3880><s%> in order to observe, <S%G2902><s%> such as the washing <S%G909><s%> of cups <S%G4221><s%> and pitchers <S%G3582><s%> and copper <S%G5473><s%> pots. <S%G5473><s%>)

And the Pharisees <S%G5330><s%> and the scribes <S%G1122><s%> asked <S%G1905><s%> Him, "Why <S%G1223><s%> <S%G5101><s%> do Your disciples <S%G3101><s%> not walk <S%G4043><s%> according <S%G2596><s%> to the tradition <S%G3862><s%> of the elders, <S%G4245><s%> but eat <S%G2068><s%> their bread <S%G740><s%> with impure <S%G2839><s%> hands <S%G5495><s%>?"

And He said <S%G3004><s%> to them, " Rightly <S%G2573><s%> did Isaiah <S%G2268><s%> prophesy <S%G4395><s%> of you hypocrites, <S%G5273><s%> as it is written, <S%G1125><s%> 'This <S%G3778><s%> people <S%G2992><s%> honors <S%G5091><s%> Me with their lips, <S%G5491><s%> But their heart <S%G2588><s%> is far <S%G4206><s%> away <S%G568><s%> <S%G4206><s%> from Me.
'But in vain <S%G3155><s%> do they worship <S%G4576><s%> Me, Teaching <S%G1321><s%> as doctrines <S%G1319><s%> the precepts <S%G1778><s%> of men. <S%G444><s%>'
"Neglecting <S%G863><s%> the commandment <S%G1785><s%> of God, <S%G2316><s%> you hold <S%G2902><s%> to the tradition <S%G3862><s%> of men. <S%G444><s%>"

He was also <S%G2532><s%> saying <S%G3004><s%> to them, "You nicely <S%G2573><s%> set <S%G114><s%> aside <S%G114><s%> the commandment <S%G1785><s%> of God <S%G2316><s%> in order <S%G2443><s%> to keep <S%G5083><s%> your tradition. <S%G3862><s%>

"For Moses <S%G3475><s%> said, <S%G3004><s%> 'Honor <S%G5091><s%> your father <S%G3962><s%> and your mother <S%G3384><s%>'; and, 'He who speaks <S%G2551><s%> evil <S%G2551><s%> of father <S%G3962><s%> or <S%G2228><s%> mother, <S%G3384><s%> let him be put <S%G5053><s%> to death <S%G2288><s%>';

but you say, <S%G3004><s%> 'If <S%G1437><s%> a man <S%G444><s%> says <S%G3004><s%> to [his] father <S%G3962><s%> or <S%G2228><s%> [his] mother, <S%G3384><s%> anything <S%G3739><s%> <S%G1437><s%> of mine <S%G1473><s%> you might have been helped <S%G5623><s%> by is Corban <S%G2878><s%> (that is to say, given <S%G1435><s%> [to God]),'
you no <S%G3765><s%> longer <S%G3765><s%> permit <S%G863><s%> him to do <S%G4160><s%> anything <S%G3762><s%> for [his] father <S%G3962><s%> or <S%G2228><s%> [his] mother; <S%G3384><s%>

[thus] invalidating <S%G208><s%> the word <S%G3056><s%> of God <S%G2316><s%> by your tradition <S%G3862><s%> which <S%G3739><s%> you have handed <S%G3860><s%> down; <S%G3860><s%> and you do <S%G4160><s%> many <S%G4183><s%> things <S%G4183><s%> such <S%G3946><s%> as that. "

And after He called <S%G4341><s%> the multitude <S%G3793><s%> to Him again, <S%G3825><s%> He [began] saying <S%G3004><s%> to them, "Listen <S%G191><s%> to Me, all <S%G3956><s%> of you, and understand: <S%G4920><s%>

there is nothing <S%G3762><s%> outside <S%G1855><s%> the man <S%G444><s%> which going <S%G1531><s%> into him can <S%G1410><s%> defile <S%G2840><s%> him; but the things which proceed <S%G1607><s%> out of the man <S%G444><s%> are what defile <S%G2840><s%> the man. <S%G444><s%>
["If <S%G1487><s%> any <S%G5100><s%> man <S%G5100><s%> has <S%G2192><s%> ears <S%G3775><s%> to hear, <S%G191><s%> let him hear. <S%G191><s%>"]

And when <S%G3753><s%> leaving <S%G575><s%> the multitude, <S%G3793><s%> He had entered <S%G1525><s%> the house, <S%G3624><s%> His disciples <S%G3101><s%> questioned <S%G1905><s%> Him about the parable. <S%G3850><s%>

And He said <S%G3004><s%> to them, "Are you so <S%G3779><s%> lacking <S%G801><s%> in understanding <S%G801><s%> also <S%G2532><s%>? Do you not understand <S%G3539><s%> that whatever <S%G3956><s%> goes <S%G1531><s%> into the man <S%G444><s%> from outside <S%G1855><s%> cannot <S%G1410><s%> <S%G3756><s%> defile <S%G2840><s%> him;

because <S%G3754><s%> it does not go <S%G1531><s%> into his heart, <S%G2588><s%> but into his stomach, <S%G2836><s%> and is eliminated <S%G1519><s%> <S%G856><s%> <S%G1607><s%>?" ([Thus He] declared <S%G2511><s%> all <S%G3956><s%> foods <S%G1033><s%> clean. <S%G2511><s%>)
And He was saying, <S%G3004><s%> "That which proceeds <S%G1607><s%> out of the man, <S%G444><s%> that is what defiles <S%G2840><s%> the man. <S%G444><s%>

"For from within, <S%G2081><s%> out of the heart <S%G2588><s%> of men, <S%G444><s%> proceed <S%G1607><s%> the evil <S%G2556><s%> thoughts, <S%G1261><s%> fornications, <S%G4202><s%> thefts, <S%G2829><s%> murders, <S%G5408><s%> adulteries, <S%G3430><s%>

deeds <S%G4124><s%> of coveting <S%G4124><s%> [and] wickedness, <S%G4189><s%> [as well as] deceit, <S%G1388><s%> sensuality, <S%G766><s%> envy, <S%G3788><s%> <S%G4190><s%> slander, <S%G988><s%> pride <S%G5243><s%> [and] foolishness. <S%G877><s%>
"All <S%G3956><s%> these <S%G3778><s%> evil <S%G4190><s%> things <S%G4190><s%> proceed <S%G1607><s%> from within <S%G2081><s%> and defile <S%G2840><s%> the man. <S%G444><s%>"

And from there <S%G1564><s%> He arose <S%G450><s%> and went <S%G565><s%> away <S%G565><s%> to the region <S%G3725><s%> of Tyre. <S%G5184><s%> And when He had entered <S%G1525><s%> a house, <S%G3614><s%> He wanted <S%G2309><s%> no <S%G3762><s%> one <S%G3762><s%> to know <S%G1097><s%> [of it;] yet <S%G2532><s%> He could <S%G1410><s%> not escape <S%G2990><s%> notice. <S%G2990><s%>

But after hearing <S%G191><s%> of Him, a woman <S%G1135><s%> whose <S%G3739><s%> little <S%G2365><s%> daughter <S%G2365><s%> had <S%G2192><s%> an unclean <S%G169><s%> spirit, <S%G4151><s%> immediately <S%G2117><s%> came <S%G2064><s%> and fell <S%G4363><s%> at His feet. <S%G4228><s%>

Now <S%G1161><s%> the woman <S%G1135><s%> was a Gentile, <S%G1674><s%> of the Syrophoenician <S%G4949><s%> race. <S%G1085><s%> And she kept asking <S%G2065><s%> Him to cast <S%G1544><s%> the demon <S%G1140><s%> out of her daughter. <S%G2364><s%>

And He was saying <S%G3004><s%> to her, "Let <S%G863><s%> the children <S%G5043><s%> be satisfied <S%G5526><s%> first, <S%G4413><s%> for it is not good <S%G2570><s%> to take <S%G2983><s%> the children's bread <S%G740><s%> and throw <S%G906><s%> it to the dogs. <S%G2952><s%>"

But she answered <S%G611><s%> and said <S%G3004><s%> to Him, "Yes, <S%G3483><s%> Lord, <S%G2962><s%> [but] even <S%G2532><s%> the dogs <S%G2952><s%> under <S%G5270><s%> the table <S%G5132><s%> feed <S%G2068><s%> on the children's crumbs. <S%G5589><s%>"

And He said <S%G3004><s%> to her, "Because <S%G1223><s%> of this <S%G3778><s%> answer <S%G3056><s%> go <S%G5217><s%> your way; <S%G5217><s%> the demon <S%G1140><s%> has gone <S%G1831><s%> out of your daughter. <S%G2364><s%>"

And going <S%G565><s%> back <S%G565><s%> to her home, <S%G3624><s%> she found <S%G2147><s%> the child <S%G3813><s%> lying <S%G906><s%> on the bed, <S%G2825><s%> the demon <S%G1140><s%> having departed. <S%G1831><s%>

And again <S%G3825><s%> He went <S%G1831><s%> out from the region <S%G3725><s%> of Tyre, <S%G5184><s%> and came <S%G2064><s%> through <S%G1223><s%> Sidon <S%G4605><s%> to the Sea <S%G2281><s%> of Galilee, <S%G1056><s%> within <S%G303><s%> <S%G3319><s%> the region <S%G3725><s%> of Decapolis. <S%G1179><s%>

And they brought <S%G5342><s%> to Him one <S%G2974><s%> who <S%G2974><s%> was deaf <S%G2974><s%> and spoke <S%G3424><s%> with difficulty, <S%G3424><s%> and they entreated <S%G3870><s%> Him to lay <S%G2007><s%> His hand <S%G5495><s%> upon him.

And He took <S%G618><s%> him aside <S%G618><s%> from the multitude <S%G3793><s%> by himself, <S%G2398><s%> and put <S%G906><s%> His fingers <S%G1147><s%> into his ears, <S%G3775><s%> and after spitting, <S%G4429><s%> He touched <S%G681><s%> his tongue <S%G1100><s%> [with the saliva;]
and looking <S%G308><s%> up to heaven <S%G3772><s%> with a deep <S%G4727><s%> sigh, <S%G4727><s%> He said <S%G3004><s%> to him, "Ephphatha! <S%G2188><s%>" that is, "Be opened! <S%G1272><s%>"

And his ears <S%G189><s%> were opened, <S%G455><s%> and the impediment <S%G1199><s%> of his tongue <S%G1100><s%> was removed, <S%G3089><s%> and he [began] speaking <S%G2980><s%> plainly. <S%G3723><s%>

And He gave <S%G1291><s%> them orders <S%G1291><s%> not to tell <S%G3004><s%> anyone; <S%G3367><s%> but the more <S%G3745><s%> He ordered <S%G1291><s%> them, the more <S%G3123><s%> widely <S%G4053><s%> they continued to proclaim <S%G2784><s%> it.

And they were utterly <S%G5249><s%> astonished, <S%G1605><s%> saying, <S%G3004><s%> "He has done <S%G4160><s%> all <S%G3956><s%> things <S%G3956><s%> well; <S%G2573><s%> He makes <S%G4160><s%> even <S%G2532><s%> the deaf <S%G2974><s%> to hear, <S%G191><s%> and the dumb <S%G216><s%> to speak. <S%G2980><s%>"
